summary: "To Kill a Mockingbird" is a popular American novel written by Harper Lee. Published in 1960, it won the Pulitzer Prize the next year. The story, set in Alabama, is about racial injustice and growing up, inspired by real-life events and people Lee knew. Atticus Finch, the main character's father, is a role model for many. Despite some controversial themes, it's widely read in schools for its lessons on tolerance. The book was turned into a successful movie in 1962. Lee's only other published book was an early draft of this novel, released in 2015.
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
